item.title: Caroline add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Seize the moment. Remember all those women on the 'Titanic' who waved off the dessert cart." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "No man is lonely while eating spaghetti: it requires so much attention." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Caroline add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "What I say is that, if a man really likes potatoes, he must be a pretty decent sort of fellow." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "You can tell a lot about a fellow's character by his way of eating jellybeans. " -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Caroline add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The thought of two thousand people crunching celery at the same time horrified me." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Charles de Gaulle
item.description: "How can you govern a country which has 246 varieties of cheese?" -- Charles de Gaulle

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "I come from a home where gravy is a beverage." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "I don't want to drive up to the pearly gates in a shiny sports car, wearing beautifully, tailored clothes, my hair expertly coiffed, and with long, perfectly manicured fingernails. I want to drive up in a station wagon that has mud on the wheels from taking kids to scout camp. I want to be there with a smudge of peanut butter on my shirt from making sandwiches for a sick neighbors children. I want to be there with a little dirt under my fingernails from helping to weed someone's garden. I want to be there with children's sticky kisses on my cheeks and the tears of a friend on my shoulder. I want the Lord to know I was really here and that I really lived." -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley
